College (present-day Tokyo Fuji University) |office1 =
President of SÅka Gakkai International |term_start1 = 26 January 1975 |office2 =
Honorary President of SÅka Gakkai |term_start2 = 24 April 1979 |office3 =
President of SÅka Gakkai |term3 = 3 May 1960 â 23 April 1979 |predecessor3
= Josei Toda |successor3 = Hiroshi HÅjÅ () }} is president of SÅka Gakkai
International (SGI), which is recognized by the United Nations as a
nongovernmental source for a variety of humanitarian and public information pro-
gram [http://www.house.mo.gov/billtracking/bills041/hlrbillspdf/0620C.01.pd-
f] , a Nichiren Buddhist lay association which claims 12 million members
[http://www.house.mo.gov/billtracking/bills041/hlrbillspdf/0620C.01.pdf] in 192 countries and territories [http://lis.virginia.gov/cgi-
bin/legp604.exe?091+ful+HJ866+pdf] , and founder of several educational,
cultural and peace research institutions. Ikeda is a Buddhist leader,
peacebuilder, educator, a prolific writer, poet, and founder of a number of
peace, cultural, and educational research institutions around the world. He is
also the founder of Soka University (Japan) and Soka University of America. As
the third president of the Soka Gakkai (value-creating society) and founder of
the Soka Gakkai International, Ikeda has developed and inspired what may be the
largest, most diverse international lay Buddhist association in the world today.
His followers, SGI members, integrate their Buddhist practice into their daily
lives, following the Lotus Sutra based teachings of Nichiren, a 13th-century
Japanese Buddhist priest. The movement inspired from him is characterized by its
emphasis on individual empowerment and social engagement to advance peace,
culture and education. Ikeda was listed in Watkins Books' Watkins Mind Body
Spirit as the 69th "most spiritually influential" living person Watkins explains: "The main three criteria are: 1) The person has to
be alive[;] 2) The person has to have made a unique and spiritual contribution
on a global scale[;] 3) The person is frequently googled, appears in Nielsen
Data, and is actively talked about throughout the Internet". in 2012, "[http://www.watkinsbooks.com/review/watkins-spiritual-100-list-
2012 Watkinsâ Spiritual 100 List for 2012: 100 Most Spiritually Influential
Living people 2012]", Watkins Books. Accessed February 13, 2013. and the
78th in 2013. "[http://www.watkinsbooks.com/review/watkins-spiritual-100-list-
2013 Watkinsâ Spiritual 100 List for 2013: 100 Most Spiritually Influential
Living people]", Watkins Books. Accessed February 13, 2013. His works have
been published in more than 40 languages [http://www.daisakuikeda.org/sub/books/books-by-
category/alphabetical-list.html] . In 2013, he is the recipient of over 300
honorary doctorates throughout the world [http://governor.hawaii.gov/wp-content/uploads/2012/09/Soka-Gakkai-
International-Day-2013-05-03.pdf] [http://lis.virginia.gov/cgi-
bin/legp604.exe?091+ful+HJ866+pdf] .
